intro: Hieracium planesidion, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are basal, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium planesidion is often found in high-altitude habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
